com.nobigsoftware.dfalex

Class DfaState<MATCHRESULT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nobigsoftware.dfalex.DfaState<MATCHRESULT>

  • public abstract class DfaState<MATCHRESULT>
extends java.lang.Object
    A state in a char-matching deterministic finite automaton (that's the google phrase) or DFA

      • DfaState

        public DfaState()

    • Method Detail

      • getNextState

        public abstract DfaState<MATCHRESULT> getNextState(char c)
        Process a character and get the next state
        Parameters:
        c - input character
        Returns:
        The DfaState that c transitions to from this one, or null if there is no such state

      • getMatch

        public abstract MATCHRESULT getMatch()
        Get the result that has been matched if we've transitioned into this state
        Returns:
        If the sequence of characters that led to this state match a pattern in the language being processed, the match result for that pattern is returned. Otherwise null.

      • getStateNumber

        public abstract int getStateNumber()
        Get the state number. All states reachable from the output of a single call to a DfaBuilder build method will be compactly numbered starting at 0.

        These state numbers can be used to maintain auxiliary information about a DFA.

        See DfaAuxiliaryInformation

        Returns:
        this state's state number

      • enumerateTransitions

        public abstract void enumerateTransitions(DfaTransitionConsumer<MATCHRESULT> consumer)
        Enumerate all the transitions out of this state
        Parameters:
        consumer - each DFA transition will be sent here

      • getSuccessorStates

        public abstract java.lang.Iterable<DfaState<MATCHRESULT>> getSuccessorStates()
        Get an Iterable of all the successor states of this state.

        Note that the same successor state may appear more than once in the interation

        Returns:
        an iterable of successor states.
